article_title: 128 suicide warning letters sent out by Gaston schools last year
article_text:
By Diane Turbyfill

Posted Feb. 14, 2015 at 12:01 AM

Updated Feb 14, 2015 at 11:22 PM

article_metadata.description: Get rid of sharp objects, medications and anything that can be used as a noose. Your daughter may try to hurt herself.	Julie Newton read the terrifying words when a school guidance counselor handed her a letter.	Newton was asked to sign the document. By doing so, she acknowledged the warning and agreed to get help for her 16-year-old daughter.	Gaston County Schools sent out 128 such letters last year, more than six times the number handed to parents in 2012. Newton took the letter seriously,
article_metadata.author: Diane Turbyfill
